description: Multi-step word problems requiring calculations with rules. Problems about counting, scheduling, quantities, and price/cost optimization.

concepts.name: Multi-Step Calculations
concepts.description: Solving problems that require multiple arithmetic operations in sequence
question_patterns: [Scenario with multiple operations]. What is the final result?
Calculate the total after applying these rules.
example_stems: Tom has 24 apples. He gives half away, then buys 10 more. How many does he have?
A recipe needs 3 cups of flour. If you triple it and then use half, how much flour do you use?

concepts.name: Rate and Speed Problems
concepts.description: Problems involving rates, speeds, or work done over time
common_misconceptions: Confusing speed, time, and distance relationships
Not accounting for different rates in different phases
question_patterns: At this rate, how long will it take to [complete task]?
If [person] works at [rate], how much [work] in [time]?
example_stems: A machine makes 50 items per hour. How many in 3.5 hours?
Walking at 4 km/h, how long to walk 6 km?

concepts.name: Cost and Price Optimization
concepts.description: Finding the best combination of items or approach to minimize cost or maximize value
common_misconceptions: Missing bulk discounts or special offers
Not checking if constraints are satisfied
question_patterns: What's the cheapest way to buy [items]?
example_stems: Pens cost $2 each or $5 for 3. What's the cheapest way to buy 7 pens?
With $20, what combination of items gives the most value?

concepts.name: Systematic Counting
concepts.description: Counting arrangements, combinations, or outcomes systematically
question_patterns: How many ways can [items] be arranged?
example_stems: How many 2-digit numbers can be formed using 1, 2, 3 without repeating?
In how many ways can 4 people line up?

concepts.name: Working Backwards
concepts.description: Starting from the end result and reversing operations to find the starting value
question_patterns: [Result] after [operations]. What was the starting value?
Working backwards, find the original number.
example_stems: After doubling and adding 5, the result is 17. What was the original number?
Maya now has 30 stickers after giving away half and getting 10 more. How many did she start with?

concepts.name: Problems with Constraints
concepts.description: Finding values that satisfy multiple conditions simultaneously
common_misconceptions: Not checking all conditions are met
question_patterns: Find a number that satisfies all these conditions.
What value makes all these statements true?
example_stems: I am thinking of a number less than 20, divisible by 3, and greater than 10. What is it?
Find the smallest number that is even, greater than 50, and a multiple of 7.
